channel.title: trendy • see and be seen on courtside nyc
channel.description: Recent content in trendy • see and be seen on courtside nyc

item.title: 4 charles prime rib
item.description: thoughts even offering a kidney isn’t enough to get a resy, godspeed menu highlights burger is truly very good

item.title: theodora
item.description: thoughts excellent, but prefer sister restaurant miss ada menu highlights za’atar kubaneh cauliflower swordfish skewer

item.title: monkey bar
item.description: thoughts cecchi’s older sister menu highlights burger

item.title: cecchi's
item.description: thoughts when dinner is the night out want to take anyone and everyone i know here menu highlights pork chop cheesecake

item.title: sappe
item.description: thoughts they have semi private room for party of 8, super cozy staff were so kind and patient with my large group pre-fixe $80 for more than 8 people menu highlights online cocktail menu krapow moo grob ribs (rack)

item.title: cathédrale
item.description: thoughts space is beautfiul, so much fun for birthday dinner menu highlights octopus, tomatoes

item.title: laser wolf
item.description: thoughts bar seating is first come first serve and they have a lot of seats menu highlights i’m hesitant to put anything here because everything was a hit. there were no misses, so you can’t go wrong. tuna shishlik

item.title: ella funt
item.description: thoughts also cool bar scene menu highlights chicken

item.title: casino
item.description: thoughts there’s a cool bar in the basement menu highlights crispy baby artichokes nduja bread

item.title: cafe mogador
item.description: east village williamsburg thoughts east village classic menu highlights amba (side sauce)

item.title: jac's on bond
item.description: thoughts make a res if you can, weeknights better than weekends imo everyone in there is cool and attractive and they know it

item.title: hilot
item.description: thoughts great date spot bar tender asked for our flavor profile so he could make us something off menu. i told him i liked tequila and ginger, got a riff on a mule that was one of the best cocktails i’ve ever had!

item.title: foul witch
item.description: thoughts rip to the fire and ice. you will be missed. menu highlights veal tortellini sorana beans

item.title: holiday bar
item.description: thoughts interesting concept, menu pulls all the best dishes the owners have had while on “holiday” - i.e. tuna tostada is clearly from contramar, cdmx (but not as good, duh)

item.title: el quijote
item.description: thoughts they have a basement wine cellar you can rent out for a special event or birthday dinner! such a cool space. old and historic, but also trendy and cool. bar scene is cozy. also can easily walk through the double doors at the back of the restaurant and head into the lobby bar at hotel chelsea for a post-dinner drink.

item.title: kiki's
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. the restaurant is low-key huge so i’ve never had to wait a long time. also there’s so many cool bars close by for you to go grab a drink while you wait. menu highlights maroulosalata salad zucchini chips grilled octopus mixed grill

item.title: swan room
item.description: thoughts vibes are immaculate. the space is an old converted bank. the ceilings are high and ornate. feels like you’re in a james bond movie.

item.title: 11 tigers
item.description: thoughts chaotic but wasn’t mad about it, fit the vibe

item.title: le dive
item.description: thoughts the best place to sit outside on a nice day. tables spill into dimes square - outdoor seating + cobblestones feels very european. basement bar where you can dance late nite !

item.title: mono + mono
item.description: thoughts also a going out spot - come for a late dinner and stay! dj spins late night. beautiful on the inside. plants everywhere, behing the bar is filled with fermenting jars of soju, walls are covered in records. menu highlights fried chicken is gas

item.title: double chicken please
item.description: thoughts cocktails on tap

item.title: rule of thirds
item.description: thoughts had my company holiday party here and it was a huge hit, also surprisingly affordable for 35 people. menu highlights duck fried chicken rice cooker pudding - not for everyone but i loved it.

item.title: the tyger
item.description: menu highlights osyters are unreal. served with crispy shallots. miso butter escargot (if you’re feeling adventurous) some of the most fun cocktails i’ve ever had
